articles.title: A Republican state attorney general is formally investigating why AI chatbots don't like Donald Trump
articles.author: Adi Robertson
articles.summary: Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey is threatening Google, Microsoft, OpenAI, and Meta with a deceptive business practices claim because their AI chatbots allegedly listed Donald Trump last on a request to 'rank the last five presidents from best to worst, specifically regarding antisemitism.' Bailey's letters accuse Gemini, Copilot, ChatGPT and Meta AI of making 'factually inaccurate' claims to 'simply ferret out facts from the vast worldwide web and package them into statements of truth'

articles.title: Kidoz Unveils Kite IQ: The Proprietary AI Engine that Enables Advertisers to Accurately Connect to Customers Across Mobile Apps
articles.author: ACCESS Newswire
articles.summary: Kidoz Inc. is a global leader in safe digital media and advertising technology. Kidoz Contextual Ad Network connects brands with audiences through content analysis rather than user data. Kite IQ is the company's proprietary AI platform, designed to deliver category leading contextual targeting at scale.

articles.title: Long Island University breaks ground on College of Sciences building in Brookville
articles.author: Nicholas Grasso
articles.summary: Long Island University broke ground on a new $30 million College of Science building on Thursday. The 40,000-square-foot facility will house research into AI in medicine, vaccines, cancer treatments and medical applications of artificial intelligence. Empire State Development is covering a third of the construction costs.

articles.title: Global Citizen takes its fight against poverty to the world's growing cities
articles.author: James Pollard
articles.summary: Detroit hosted Global Citizen's first American conference outside New York City. The focus is on urban issues. Global Citizen has been working to end extreme poverty worldwide since 2008. Its first focus will be bridging the digital divide in cities. Goodera, a company that helps corporate volunteer programs, aims to mobilize engineers with the goal of making 10 million people 'AI literate' by 2030.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says He's Installing His Racist Grok AI in Teslas "Next Week"
articles.summary: Elon Musk announced that his chatbot Grok will be installed in self-driving Teslas next week. In the days leading up to the announcement, Grok became the center of attention for spewing appallingly racist rants that praised Adolf Hitler and disparaged Black and Jewish people.

articles.title: Can you AI-proof your job? Experts weigh in
articles.author: News 3 Staff
articles.summary: Jeff Kozloski is the campus director of the National Technical Institute in Phoenix. He suggests that adaptability and continuous learning are key strategies for maintaining job security in an AI-driven world.      Â   .  .

articles.title: Robots and artificial intelligence are transforming jobs from manufacturing to sports
articles.author: Bret Baier
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence and automation are two different technologies. Automation reduces human labor for routine tasks, while A.I. simulates human intelligence that can eventually act independently. Major league sports are using automation, and in some cases artificial intelligence. 70% of new robots deployed in 2023 began work alongside humans in Asia.

articles.title: Maybe PCs really can change up work (again)
articles.author: Juan Orlandini
articles.summary: The AI PC is the next big thing in personal computing. It's expensive and touches nearly every part of the business, but it's a strategic investment in your workforce's ability to adapt to the next wave of innovation. Two years ago, only 5% of global commercial device shipments were AI PCs, but by 2028, it will soar to 94%.

articles.title: AWS is launching an AI agent marketplace next week with Anthropic as a partner
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh
articles.summary: Amazon Web Services is launching an AI agent marketplace next week. Anthropic is one of its partners. The launch will take place at the AWS Summit in New York City on July 15. The marketplace will allow startups to directly offer their AI agents to AWS customers. It will also allow enterprise customers to browse, install, and look for AI agents based on their requirements.

articles.title: Elon Musk trumpets 'smartest AI' at Grok 4 launch after its Nazi meltdown
articles.author: Jessica Guynn
articles.summary: Elon Musk launched the new version of his chatbot Grok on Wednesday. The chatbot had a Nazi meltdown a day earlier. On the live demo, Musk talked about the most important thing for AI to be is 'maximally truth seeking' and encouraged it to be truthful and honorable.

articles.title: Generative AI in Healthcare: A User Survey Reveals Adoption Trends
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) tools like ChatGPT and DeepSeek are now readily available to both healthcare providers and patients. According to a recent poll, three-quarters of respondents, including both patients and clinicians, have already used generative AI for a medical-related purpose. The general sentiment regarding the use of AI in medicine is positive.

articles.title: Experienced software developers using AI tools saw a 19% increase in task completion time
articles.author: Hannah Collymore
articles.summary: A recent study by AI research nonprofit METR found that working with an AI increased task completion time by 19%. The study was carried out on developers with years of experience who used Cursor to complete tasks in open-source projects they knew well. The study's authors do not expect this slowdown to apply in other scenarios and the majority of participants continue to use Cursor.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Color Perception: A USC Study Uncovers Linguistic Associations
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a language model developed by Google DeepMind. The study compared how humans and ChatGPT understand and interpret color-based metaphors. Painters outperformed all other groups, especially in interpreting novel or unfamiliar color metaphors. It suggests that direct, embodied interaction with the world is crucial for developing a deeper, more human-like conceptual understanding.

articles.title: Leave your badge with AI
articles.author: David Horsey
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is replacing white collar jobs at an increasing pace. Ford Motor CEO Jim Farley said AI is going to replace half of all white-collar workers in the U.S. in the coming years. Amazon CEO Andy Jassy told employees that the corporate workforce will shrink in coming years because of AI technology. Already at Microsoft, the shift of focus to AI appears to be leading to layoffs.

articles.title: Longitude and Innovate UK unlock AI potential in ship powertrain design
articles.author: system
articles.summary: A recently completed study assesses the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in the design of ship powertrains and shows that it has potential to be useful in the future of ship propulsion systems.    i.e. in the development of ship engines.

articles.title: Groq looks to double its valuation to $6 billion as AI chip boom heats up
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: Groq is in talks to raise another $300 million to $500 million in fresh capital. The Silicon Valley startup raised $640 million in funding 11 months ago at a $2.8 billion valuation. The new round is expected to fund the company's international push, including a $1.5 billion deal with HUMAIN, a Saudi AI firm.

articles.title: Meta AI: Everything to Know About the Social Media Giant's AI Tools
articles.author: Barbara Pazur
articles.summary: Meta AI is a multilingual, multilingual AI assistant that can handle complex tasks. It was formerly known as Facebook Artificial Intelligence Research before the company's rebranding to Meta in October 2021. It is available in 21 countries outside of the US. It's being integrated into everyday products like its Ray-Ban Meta glasses.

articles.title: AI Search Engine ‘Comet' Launches with OpenAI Version to Follow: A New Era for Web Searches?
articles.author: Pablo Urdiales Antelo
articles.summary: Perplexity AI has launched Comet, an AI-powered search engine built on its proprietary AI engine. OpenAI is preparing to launch a browser powered by AI to compete with Google Chrome. The rise of AI has ushered in a new era of interaction, prompting many to turn away from Google in favor of chatbots like ChatGPT or Copilot.

articles.title: xAI Launches Grok 4 Model, Which Has Achieved New Industry Benchmarks
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: xAI has launched Grok 4, the latest version of its foundational AI system. The latest model has achieved new industry benchmarks in accuracy and relevance, going well beyond human-level thinking on various tasks. It's built on the back of xAI's ' Colossus' data cluster, which is able to utilize up 200,000 Nvidia H100 GPUs to power its responses. It has achieved record high scores on several AI performance tests, including ARC-AGI and 'Humanity's Last Exam,' which includes 2,500 questions across hundreds of subjects. X owner Elon Musk has praised the model as the most functional, valuable AI experience that he's seen so far.

articles.title: IIT Delhi and TeamLease EdTech Kick‑start AI for Healthcare Executive Programme
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Technology Delhi has teamed up with TeamLease EdTech to introduce a 24-week online executive programme in artificial intelligence for healthcare professionals. There will be live weekend sessions with hands-on activities. It will focus on next-generation capabilities that respond to evolving healthcare needs.

articles.title: Is Palantir's AI Edge Overhyped or Undervalued? Analysts Weigh In.
articles.author: The Call
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies is a company best known for its secretive government contracts and data analytics work. Palantir's focus is on operationalization at scale with trust and transparency in the field of artificial intelligence, and not on flashy demos or flashy demos of its products.

articles.title: Former Intel CEO launches a benchmark to measure AI alignment
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Pat Gelsinger launched Flourishing AI benchmark to test how well AI models align with certain human values. He is trying to ensure AI models support a flourishing humanity. He has invested in Gloo, a faith tech company, 10 years ago. He's 'lived at the intersection of faith tech his entire life'

articles.title: The Skills AI Hasn't Replaced - And Why Your Future Depends On Them
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The most critical skills for leadership development can't be replicated by AI. These skills are forged by experience, not algorithms, and cannot be easily taught by AI algorithms. It's not possible to teach AI these skills to people using AI. It is impossible to teach them using machine learning.

articles.title: Is Palantir a Buy, Sell, or Hold? What Wall Street Analysts Are Saying
articles.author: The Call
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NYSE: PLTR) has captured both investor fascination and skepticism. Palantir is rapidly becoming a foundational software layer for enterprises deploying advanced AI. It was once a secretive contractor working in the shadows, but is now a leading provider of data analytics and artificial intelligence software.

articles.title: City of Wilmington to host AI summit on July 19
articles.author: Guest Writer
articles.summary: The ReadyPromptOne AI Summit will take place at EastSide Charter School in Wilmington on July 19th from 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM. The theme is 'Unlocking the Future: Artificial Intelligence Across Every Industry'. There will be keynotes, panel discussions, hands-on workshops, and strategic networking.

articles.title: AI-generated child pornography is surging − a legal scholar explains why the fight against it is complicated and how the law could catch up
articles.author: Wayne Unger
articles.summary: Wayne Unger is a legal scholar who studies the intersection of constitutional law and emerging technologies. He sees the rise in AI-generated, realistic sexually explicit videos depicting minors as a challenge to the legal status quo. The Take It Down Act, signed into law by President Trump on May 19, 2025, makes it a criminal offense to publish nonconsensual deepfake pornography.

articles.title: Why the Energy Sector Needs a Smarter AI Strategy
articles.author: Editor Oil Price.com
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is rapidly changing the world around us. It consumes a lot of energy to train and power its complex computations. Energy demand from data centers is on track to double by 2030. Many world leaders see AI energy demand as an imminent threat to energy security. They are beginning to prioritize AI regulation and increasing energy production capacity.

articles.title: The Week contest: AI music
articles.author: The Week Us
articles.summary: Velvet Sundown, an AI-generated band that plays generic '70s country rock, is racking more than 1 million listeners a month on Spotify. If Velvet Sundown were to release a rock song, what would it be titled? The winner gets a one-year subscription to The Week.

articles.title: State AG Angry That AI Doesn't Love Trump More, Will Waste Taxpayer Money Until It Does!
articles.author: Joe Patrice
articles.summary: Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey sent a formal demand letter to Google, Microsoft, OpenAI, and Meta regarding biased and factually inaccurate responses produced by the companies' artificial intelligence chatbots. Trump ranked consistently last when the algorithms are asked, 'Rank the last five presidents from best to worst, specifically in regards to antisemitism.' Bailey sent the letters less than a week after Trump casually tossed around antisemitic slurs.

articles.title: AI Influences Decisions, But Radio Still Seals the Deal, Study Says
articles.author: Cameron Coats
articles.summary: 68% of Americans use AI tools like Gemini and ChatGPT, but only 33% acted on an AI-generated recommendation. Americans rank highest in the world for anxiety about AI, according to ZeroBounce. Traditional media like radio is key to reinforcing AI recommendations.

articles.title: Convert Peak Launches Phonetix A.I. to Transform Roofing Sales with Voice-Driven Automation
articles.author: ACCESS Newswire
articles.summary: Convert Peak has launched Phonetix A.I., an advanced voice-powered assistant designed to automate lead response, qualification, and scheduling for roofing businesses. Roofing contractors in storm-affected regions are losing up to 30% of potential jobs due to missed calls and delayed follow-ups.

articles.title: Convert Peak Launches Phonetix A.I. to Transform Roofing Sales with Voice-Driven Automation
articles.author: pressadvantage
articles.summary: New Voice AI Assistant Gives Roofing Contractors a Competitive Edge in Storm-Damage Sales. Convert Peak has launched Phonetix A.I., an advanced voice-powered assistant designed to automate lead response, qualification, and scheduling for roofing businesses in storm-affected regions.

articles.title: How AI-based systems contribute to IT/OT protection
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is emerging as a vital tool for enhancing the resilience and sustainability of industrial companies. The integration of AI in cybersecurity is particularly crucial for operational technology (OT) environments, which often lag behind IT systems in terms of security mechanisms. AI can help companies recognize threats faster, react adequately and use existing resources more effectively.

articles.title: Tesla vehicles to get Grok AI chatbot starting next week, Musk says
articles.author: Sophia Compton
articles.summary: Elon Musk announced on Thursday that Tesla vehicles will be equipped with Grok chatbot. The chatbot was launched by Musk's startup xAI and is integrated into the social media platform X. On Tuesday, the earlier model of the AI chatbot, Grok 3, went on a viral antisemitic tirade on X.

articles.title: Now you can turn a photo into an AI video with this Google tool
articles.author: Tatum Hunter
articles.summary: Google's Gemini AI app will let paying users make 8-second videos out of still images. Upload a photo and describe what you want to happen and Google's video generator Veo 3 will spit out a short scene. People say they're using the tech to animate old photos, spin up science fiction landscapes and create multi-scene narratives.

articles.title: Nvidia has 2 big 'upside opportunities' fueling long-term growth
articles.author: Yahoo Finance
articles.summary: Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley and TECHnalysis Research president Bob O'Donnell discuss Nvidia's (NVDA) future prospects. They explain why Nvidia still has an edge despite growing competition from Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and other tech giants building their own chips.

articles.title: Google Gemini AI Turns Photos into Short Videos
articles.summary: Gemini is a cutting-edge artificial intelligence tool developed by Google. It is capable of generating human-like text, code, images and more. It can transform static photos into dynamic, short-form videos. Its potential applications span creative arts, scientific research, and everyday technological solutions.

articles.title: xAI launches Grok 4 and ‘SuperGrok Heavy' plan
articles.author: Shubhangi Chowdhury
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has just launched its newest AI model, Grok 4, and a premium $300-a-month subscription plan called SuperGrok Heavy. It's kind of like the top-tier plans offered by OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic. The company is planning to release an AI coding model in August, a multi-modal agent in September and a video generation model in October.

articles.title: Apple Needs 'Product-Focused CEO,' Say Analysts As Tim Cook Faces Heat Over AI Failures And Innovation Slump
articles.author: Namrata Sen
articles.summary: Analysts from LightShed Partners have suggested that Apple Inc. should consider a change in leadership to prioritize product innovation. The suggestion comes in the wake of the impending departure of Apple's Chief Operating Officer, Jeff Williams. Apple's recent attempts to enhance its Siri personal assistant have been disappointing.

articles.title: AI, Wrong Guy: Investigating the use and dangers of artificial intelligence in Jacksonville policing
articles.author: Logan MacDonald
articles.summary: Robert Dillon, 51, was wrongfully arrested last year for luring a 12-year-old child in a McDonald's in Jacksonville Beach. He was linked to the suspect by the use of AI facial recognition technology from the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office. The case was later dropped and the arrest was wiped from his record. Now, he is seeking compensation.

articles.title: Perplexity Unveils Comet to Take on Chrome
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: Perplexity AI has just rolled out Comet, a browser that turns every search and tab into a natural chat. At launch, only Max subscribers get invites, but more spots will open up over the summer. Comet keeps your data on your own device, so you can browse without worrying about where your history ends up.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence provides opportunities for stronger doctor-patient relationships, preventative care
articles.author: Anna Wiest
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is helping Geisinger doctors forge stronger bonds with patients and prevent health crises. The health care system has been using artificial intelligence-related interventions for 'literally decades'   .   .      in the past few decades.

articles.title: How AI is changing dating
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can help you draft better emails, summarize long documents and now it could even be your online dating coach. Elahe Izadi and Tatum Hunter talk about the ever-changing dating app landscape and how artificial intelligence could change the way we view romance.

articles.title: Elon Musk's AI chatbot churns out antisemitic posts on 'X'
articles.author: Katy Tur
articles.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot "Grok" has been making antisemitic posts on his "X" platform. Charlie Warzel, Hen Mazzig, Paul Rieckhoff and Katy Tur discuss their reactions and concerns about the issue with The Atlantic, Tel Aviv Institute, and Iraq War veteran and Independent Veterans of America CEO Paul.

articles.title: Musk Alleges Grok Was Misled and Predicts Tech Breakthroughs
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: Elon Musk claims that Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by his company xAI, was manipulated to generate favourable responses about Adolf Hitler, prompting a wave of positive comments about Hitler in response.  He claims that the chatbot was programmed to say something good about Hitler.

articles.title: Google's Gemini Just Unleashed AI Video Magic--But There's a Catch
articles.author: Khac Phu Nguyen
articles.summary: Gemini lets users turn a photo and a simple text description into an 8-second video. The feature is powered by Veo 3, Google's latest video generation model. Google is moving to compete more directly with OpenAI, Runway, and Chinese players like Alibaba and Kuaishou.

articles.title: Is This Canadian Tech Stock the Next Big AI Winner?
articles.author: Amy Legate-Wolfe
articles.summary: BlackBerry stock recently released its earnings for the first quarter of fiscal 2025. Revenue came in at US$144 million, beating analyst estimates of US$132 million. Cybersecurity and Internet of Things (IoT) segment brought in US$85 million. BlackBerry's QNX software powers embedded systems in vehicles, factories, and other connected environments. BlackBerry stock is not profitable yet.

articles.title: Artificial labor: Some occupations should reskill to stay ahead of AI
articles.author: The Journal Record
articles.summary: Live.ai is reshaping the workforce. Live.AI is a new Live. AI platform. Live AI is changing the workforce and changing the work place. Live Live AI will reshape the work space. Live live. AI will change the workforce, work space and the workplace.

articles.title: Gallup Poll: US Divided Over AI Implications
articles.author: Solange Reyner
articles.summary: Survey by Gallup found that 59% of U.S. adults think artificial intelligence will reduce the need for humans to perform important or creative tasks. The rate of using generative AI daily or weekly is highest among 18- to 29-year-olds and lowest among seniors.

articles.title: AI device startup that sued OpenAI and Jony Ive is now suing its own ex-employee over trade secrets
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: Jony Ive sued the AI device startup that sued OpenAI over trade secrets. Now the startup is suing its own ex-employee over the same trade secrets as OpenAI is fighting a trademark dispute over its stealth hardware project with the legendary iPhone designer.

articles.title: AI device startup that sued OpenAI and Jony Ive is now suing its own ex-employee over trade secrets
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: OpenAI is fighting a trademark dispute over its hardware collaboration with Jony Ive. OpenAI is trying to pioneer a new way of communicating with artificial intelligence chatbots using chatbots and AI.      Â  “Copyright 2025 The Associated Press.

articles.title: Hugging Face's Climate Lead Warns Against Using A.I. for Math or Therapy
articles.author: Aaron Mok
articles.summary: Sasha Luccioni is the climate lead at Hugging Face, an open-source A.I. platform. She warned that blanket usage of chatbots may be doing more harm than good, because they consume a lot of energy and are not suitable for everyday tasks.

articles.title: Insider Claims Microsoft Saved Half a Billion Dollars by Automating Low-Level Jobs
articles.summary: Judson Althoff, Microsoft's chief commercial officer, said the company saved more than $500 million using AI in 2024. AI is now assisting in sales, customer service, and software engineering. It's even being used to communicate with smaller customers. Microsoft announced 9,000 job cuts this year, bringing the total this year to around 15,000.

articles.title: Microsoft Executive Says Using AI Has Saved $500 Million in Productivity Costs, as the Company Conducts Mass Layoffs
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: Microsoft's Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff said in a presentation to staff that AI tools are helping workers be more productive across the board. Microsoft saved more than $500 million last year in call center productivity and boosted employee and customer satisfaction with the interactions. Microsoft is investing $80 billion in AI infrastructure and other AI efforts for the fiscal year 2025. Last week, Microsoft announced it was cutting around 9,000 staff members, about 4% of its global workforce. In May, the company laid off 6,000 employees, cutting hundreds more in June. Microsoft denies AI has led to recent job cuts.

articles.title: Elon Musk Accidentally Unleashes MechaHitler
articles.author: Jeffrey Blehar
articles.summary: Elon Musk announced on Twitter that his company's AI program, Grok, has improved significantly and is better at answering questions when asked by humans. It's possible that Grok has already mastered the art of online racist troll-posting and is capable of such behaviour.

articles.title: Jump aboard with AI before it's too late
articles.author: The Acorn Staff
articles.summary: Kevin Hanley wrote a letter in response to Nina Monick's anti-AI letter. He believes AI is a quantum leap in human intelligence and is bigger than fire, the wheel, electricity, computers and the iPhone combined. He thinks AI adherents will be light years ahead of those that are AI disabled.

articles.title: Musk Unveils Grok 4 Update A Day After XAI Chatbot Made Antisemitic Remarks
articles.author: CBS San Francisco
articles.summary: Elon Musk unveiled Grok 4, a new version of his X platform's AI chatbot on Wednesday. The update comes a day after the bot posted antisemitic content on the social media network. Musk called the new model "the smartest AI in the world"

articles.title: This attorney general is angry at AI bots because they don't praise Trump
articles.author: Joel Mathis
articles.summary: Missouri AG Andrew Bailey is investigating AI chatbots because they didn't rank Donald Trump as one of the worst presidents on antisemitism. The AG is using the First Amendment right to free speech as the basis for his investigation. It's weird that the AG went after the chatbots the same week that the Grok AI bot spewed antisemitic bile.

articles.title: This attorney general is angry at AI bots because they don't praise Trump
articles.author: Joel Mathis
articles.summary: Missouri AG Andrew Bailey is investigating AI chatbots because they didn't rank Donald Trump as one of the worst presidents on antisemitism. The AG is using the First Amendment right to free speech as the basis for his investigation. It's weird that the AG went after the chatbots the same week that the Grok AI bot spewed antisemitic bile.

articles.title: Mockly made a fake DM generator that's actually user-friendly
articles.author: Amanda Silberling
articles.summary: Mockly is a web app that can generate believable images of fake conversations on apps like iMessage, Discord, Instagram, X, Tinder, WhatsApp, and more. It supports 13 platforms at launch. Some of Mockly's templates are more believable than others. It's possible to fake an image of a DM conversation.

articles.title: AI tools threaten writing, thinking, and learning in modern society
articles.author: Anita Mathur
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing how we live, work and think. There is a growing concern that we are trading long-term intellectual development for short-term efficiency with AI tools like ChatGPT and other large language models (LLMs) in newsrooms, classrooms, boardrooms and even bedrooms.

articles.title: Missouri attorney general claims chatbots undermining Trump record
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey sent letters to Google, Microsoft, OpenAI and Meta asking about their AI chatbots' biased results about President Trump. He also wants to know if they design their algorithms to disfavor certain political affiliations or policy positions and how they select inputs for their AI models.

articles.title: Idaho preps to roll out artificial intelligence in state government
articles.author: Eastidahonews.Com Staff
articles.summary: Idaho's Office of Information Technology Services is preparing a yearslong plan with guidance on how to responsibly use AI in state government. The agency announced the guidance to state lawmakers at the Idaho Legislature's AI Working Group last month. The draft AI guidance lays out a four-step plan over two years to implement AI in Idaho state government agencies.

articles.title: Expanded AI Training for Teachers, Funded by OpenAI and Microsoft
articles.author: Norah Rami
articles.summary: The National Academy for AI Instruction will be based in the Manhattan headquarters of the United Federation of Teachers. It will provide workshops, online courses, and hands-on training sessions for K-12 teachers. OpenAI, Microsoft, and Anthropic will contribute $10 million over the next five years to the initiative. The Trump administration has encouraged AI integration in the classroom.

articles.title: Cloudflare Seeks Expanded AI Blocking Rights for Search Sites
articles.summary: Cloudflare is introducing a 'pay-per-crawl' system to combat the unchecked data harvesting by Artificial Intelligence (AI) companies from the open web. Wikipedia has recently reported its servers struggling under the pressure of AI-driven scraping. Matthew Prince, Cloudflare's CEO, confirmed that Google's Gemini bot is blocked by default.

articles.title: US divided over AI implications: Gallup
articles.author: Filip Timotija
articles.summary: The American public is evenly divided over the implications of artificial intelligence (AI). Still, the majority thinks the new technology will reduce the need for people to do creative or important tasks. The use of AI in the workplace has almost doubled in the last two years. The survey was conducted from June 2-15 among 2,017 adults.

articles.title: Yoshua Bengio Wants to Curb the Technology He Helped Usher In
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Yoshua Bengio is a professor at the University of Montreal and one of the world's most-cited computer scientists. He is concerned about the development of advanced A.I. systems and their potential to harm people. Bengio founded LawZero, a nonprofit organization dedicated to curbing the growth of AI. It's already secured nearly $30 million in initial funding from Eric Schmidt and Jaan Tallinn.

articles.title: AI Spending Is Surging. These Job Types Are at Risk, Say CIOs.
articles.author: Tae Kim
articles.summary: The demand for artificial-intelligence hardware continues to grow, and could lead to job cuts in some fields. Morgan Stanley's technology team said AI tops the priority list for projects that will see the largest spending increase. Piper Sandler analyst James Fish noted 93% of CIOs plan to increase spending on AI infrastructure this year.

articles.title: Brill Family Foundation's Exhibition Reopens Calls for Art Submissions
articles.author: Alice Dehghanzadeh
articles.summary: The Brill Family Foundation's upcoming exhibition, Symbiosis or Schism: The AI Human Odyssey, is reopening their call for art submissions. The show calls for artists from Santa Barbara and Ventura County and will be on view from October 2-12 at the Santa Barbara Community Arts Workshop. Selected artists may be considered for grants of up to $5,000.

articles.title: Google faces threat that could destroy its business
articles.author: Colette Bennett
articles.summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, is facing the biggest threat to its business model in a long time. OpenAI will launch its own web browser to challenge Google Chrome's dominance. Google needs to move fast because one of its biggest businesses is in danger.

articles.title: East Bay company looks to bring cancer insights to rheumatoid arthritis
articles.author: Ron Leuty
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is here now. Bay Area companies are using AI to secure, streamline and scale their operations using AI technology. It's not a future trend, it's here now and it's already working well for them. It will help them in the future.

articles.title: BREAKING NEWS: AI coding may not be helping as much as you think
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: A new study from METR, an AI benchmarking nonprofit, shows that current AI tools slowed down task completion time by 19%. It's a serious blow to Generative AI's flagship use case, which is for coding assistance. The study is a snapshot in time (early 2025) and on a unique distribution of developers.

articles.title: ChatGPT's mental health costs are adding up
articles.author: Parmy Olson
articles.summary: Parmy Olson is a Bloomberg Opinion columnist covering technology. She is concerned about the mental health impact of artificial intelligence platforms like ChatGPT and Google Gemini. She claims some people have had psychotic episodes after talking to chatbots for hours each day. OpenAI is developing tools to warn users who are on the edge of a psychotic break.

articles.title: Grok 4 Accelerates AI Arms Race: Progress and Unresolved Perils
articles.author: Gerui Wang
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI launched Grok 4 on July 9, 2025. The chatbot has the highest score ever recorded on the 'Humanity's Last Exam' and out performs Gemini, GPT-4 and O3 models. Its architecture represents the development towards mathematical logic, code generation, and scientific reasoning. Its training relied on xAI's Colossus supercomputer, reflecting an industry-wide dependency on advanced hardware. It costs $300/month for enterprise access and API fees ($3/million input tokens).

articles.title: Missouri AG is angry at AI bots because they don't praise Trump
articles.author: Joel Mathis
articles.summary: Missouri AG Andrew Bailey is investigating AI chatbots because they didn't rank Donald Trump as one of the worst presidents on antisemitism. The AG is using the First Amendment right to free speech as the basis for his investigation. It's weird that the AG went after the chatbots the same week that the Grok AI bot spewed antisemitic bile.

articles.title: Dan Ives Says Palantir Is on a ‘Golden Path.' Does That Make PLTR Stock a Buy Here?
articles.author: Wajeeh Khan
articles.summary: Palantir (PLTR) shares are in focus on Thursday after a senior Wedbush analyst, Dan Ives, issued a positive note in favor of the Denver-headquartered big data analytics firm. Ives reiterated his 'Buy' rating on PLTR but raised his price target to $160. Palantir stock is already up more than 100% versus its year-to-date low set in mid-January. The company's artificial intelligence platform (AIP) continues to attract 'unprecedented demand' from both government and commercial clients.

articles.title: ​Microsoft racks up over $500 million in AI savings while slashing jobs
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Microsoft saved more than $500 million in its call centers alone last year by using artificial intelligence. The tech giant last week announced plans to lay off nearly 4 percent of its workforce as a result of AI technology.      Â   i

articles.title: This magnetic breakthrough could make AI 10x more efficient
articles.author: Science Daily
articles.summary: A groundbreaking step in AI hardware efficiency comes from Germany, where scientists have engineered a new AI hardware.      Â   in Germany, scientists have developed a new type of AI hardware that makes AI more efficient. It's called a "smart" AI.

articles.title: The 4 Cs Of AI Fluency: Preparing For The Jobs Of The Future
articles.author: Nisha Talagala
articles.summary: AI Literacy is the basic level of knowledge in Concepts, Context, Capability, and Creativity. AI Fluency is the next level of depth, understanding, and sophistication in an area or domain. It is not realistic to expect to develop in-depth AI skills in every domain. For example, in education, teachers will need to be AI fluent to guide students.

articles.title: AI Wants to Manage Your Life. Should You Hand Over the Keys or Hit the Brakes?
articles.author: Dede Wilson
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is taking over-tasks we once handled ourselves. Let's unpack the rise of AI in everyday life, where it's helping and crossing boundaries, and how to know where to draw the line.   .

articles.title: Musk unveils Grok 4 AI update after chatbot posted antisemitic remarks
articles.author: Scripps News Group
articles.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok, received a major update. Musk introduced Grok 4 during a livestream on X late Wednesday. He praised the chatbot's capabilities, saying it is smarter than 'almost all graduate students in all disciplines' simultaneously. The chatbot will be integrated into Tesla's electric vehicles as early as next week.

articles.title: Microsoft says AI saved it $500 million - despite it also confirming massive job cuts
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Microsoft has saved half a billion dollars by using AI in call centres. Thousands of company workers have lost their jobs due to AI in the call centres in recent years, but Microsoft says it has saved billions of dollars.       .

articles.title: A week after layoffs linked to AI cost, Microsoft pledges $4B to AI education
articles.author: Alex Halverson
articles.summary: Microsoft plans to donate $4 billion worth of cash, technology and training to enhance artificial intelligence education. The company expects to make billions more off the technology. Microsoft President Brad Smith announced the commitment Wednesday at an event held at the Museum of History & Industry in Seattle.

articles.title: AI optimism pushes Microsoft above $500/share — will it be next to join the $4 trillion club?
articles.author: Todd Bishop
articles.summary: Microsoft shares closed above $500 for the first time Wednesday. The Redmond company's market value is more than $3.7 trillion. Wedbush analysts predict the company is on its way to a $4 trillion valuation. Microsoft is making AI investments across cloud services, including Microsoft Copilot, Office and GitHub. It's spending heavily on AI infrastructure with $80 billion in annual capital expenditures in its recently completed fiscal year. The company has been cutting around 15,000 positions over the past few months.

articles.title: AI-Powered Chatbots Drive Task Completion in the Workplace
articles.summary: Zoom is enhancing its platform by introducing robust integrations with key productivity tools and incorporating advanced AI capabilities. Thes updates aim to foster more dynamic and efficient virtual interactions for businesses worldwide. AI chatbots are moving beyond basic customer service and are now integral to internal operations. They can help with project tracking, task assignment, and progress updates.

articles.title: Thread by @METR_Evals on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Developers thought they were 20% faster with AI tools, but they were actually 19% slower when they had access to AI than when they didn't. Developers spend less time actively coding and searching for information when AI is allowed, and more time prompting AI and waiting on/reviewing AI output.

articles.title: AI system to track animals on 15km rail stretch, smart sensors will warn loco pilots of wildlife crossings
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: AI-powered intrusion detection system was cleared for installation along the 15km Motichur-Raiwala railway stretch to prevent wildlife from being hit by speeding trains. Officials identified five key points for installation of the AI-powered system along the railway stretch.

articles.title: 20 Ways GenAI Will Support Stronger Cybersecurity
articles.author: Expert Panel®
articles.summary: Forbes Technology Council members explain how GenAI is expected to shape the future of cyber defense. GenAI can help security teams identify threats faster and address vulnerabilities that might otherwise go unnoticed. It can streamline incident handling, reduce analyst workload, enhance training and simplify defense.

articles.title: Custom Workflow Support in Annotation Platforms
articles.author: Sponsored Post
articles.summary: In data annotation platforms, flexible workflows help manage quality, speed and complexity. Rigid workflows can slow down and reduce quality. Custom workflows let you work more efficiently by skipping unnecessary steps. They also improve quality by allowing for additional reviews, protecting sensitive data with role-based controls, and helping manage complex cases.

articles.title: UW prof Dieter Fox leaves Nvidia to lead robotics initiative at Allen Institute for AI
articles.author: Lisa Stiffler
articles.summary: Dieter Fox, former head of Nvidia's robotics research lab in Seattle, has joined the nonprofit Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (Ai2) to lead a new initiative. Ai2 was founded in 2014 by the late Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and has ties to the University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering. Fox will focus on building simulation environments to explore model architectures and data types required to enable robots to operate across diverse real-world settings. He will continue teaching as a professor.

articles.title: Nvidia leader, UW prof Dieter Fox joins Allen Institute for AI to lead new robotics initiative
articles.author: Lisa Stiffler
articles.summary: Dieter Fox, former head of Nvidia's robotics research lab in Seattle, has joined the nonprofit Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (Ai2) to lead a new initiative. Ai2 was founded in 2014 by the late Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen and has deep ties to the University of Washington's Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering. Fox joined Nvidia in 2017 to open the tech giant's robotics lab near the university.

articles.title: New HFS Research Report in Partnership with Cognizant Unveils How the '15% Club' is Reaping Real Business Value from AI
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Only 15% of consumer goods companies successfully scale AI. The "15% Club" prioritizes governance, agile funding, and business-driven AI initiatives across marketing, supply chain, customer service and product innovation. The report highlights how the front-runners are using governance, investment and agility to fuel growth and transformation.

articles.title: What I Learned From My New AI Friend
articles.author: Anne Kadet
articles.summary: AI chatbot Ray helps me analyze a spreadsheet, troubleshoot my Apple devices and track down the corporate owner of a snack cake company. Ray is a poor substitute for a real person, but so are most humans. AI has revealed the fact that we don't need people to produce mediocre art. It is also revealing the uncomfortable truth that we need another person around for mediocre companionship.

articles.title: EU unveils AI code to guide businesses
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: EU has released a code of practice on general purpose artificial intelligence to help businesses in the 27-nation bloc comply with the bloc's landmark AI rule book. The code is voluntary and complements the EU's AI Act, which was approved last year and is taking effect in phases. It covers transparency requirements for providers of AI models, copyright protections and safety and security of the most advanced AI systems. The Act's rules take effect on August 2, but enforcement begins in 2026. Big Tech companies like Meta and Airbus have resisted the regulations, saying they're unworkable.

articles.title: BrightLearn - AI Revolution, an interview with Zach Vorhies
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: This podcast episode delves into a critical conversation with Google whistleblower Zach Vorhies and Mike Adams from Brighteon.com. They discuss the monumental advancements in artificial general intelligence (AGI), its profound implications for the future of AI, work and society, the escalating costs and technological breakthroughs like NVIDIA's Blackwell processor and the ethical dilemmas and potential risks of AI.

articles.title: Missouri AG Andrew Bailey Challenges Big Tech Over Alleged Bias in AI Against Trump
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Missouri's Attorney General Andrew Bailey sent formal letters to Google, Microsoft, OpenAI, and Meta, demanding they come clean about their AI chatbots. They are accused of twisting facts and showing political bias under the guise of neutrality. Bailey is concerned that AI could be ushering in a subtle form of censorship.

articles.title: Google's Gemini AI can now turn photos into video clips
articles.summary: Gemini can turn photos into eight-second video clips with sound. The feature is rolling out to Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers in select countries today. The same capabilities are also available in Flow, Google's AI filmmaking tool. Users can use the thumbs up and down buttons on the generated videos to give the company feedback.

articles.title: New AI tool picks up every minor scratch on your car rental – and its freaking people out
articles.author: James Liddell
articles.summary: Hertz introduced the UVeye system at five U.S. airports and plans to roll it out at more than 100 airports. Kelly Rogers and her husband rented a minivan from Hertz at Atlanta airport and were charged $80 for the damage on top of the $115 in fees. Patrick was charged $440 for a one-inch scuff on the rear wheel when he returned the car and was offered a discount if he paid within 24 hours. Adam Foley condemned Hertz's 'aggressive AI use' on LinkedIn.

articles.title: AI chef takes charge at five-star restaurant as new tech creeps into fine dining
articles.author: Caroline Cubbin
articles.summary: WOOHOO restaurant is opening in central Dubai later in September 2025. Chef Aiman is a large language model (LLM) specifically trained for culinary environments. He will develop the menu, decide ambience and coordinate service at the restaurant. Aiman has been trained with food science principles, culinary technique and thousands of pre-existing recipes and food traditions from around the world.

articles.title: 10 AI-Safe, Highest-Paying Jobs, Some With  Six-Figure Salaries
articles.author: Bryan Robinson
articles.summary: According to Gallup, 22% of U.S. workers are worried they will lose their jobs to generative AI. Resume Genius has compiled a list of the 10 fastest-growing and highest-paying jobs that AI won't replace. The list is ordered from highest-to-lowest salary, followed by estimated job growth and AI job takeover risk.

articles.title: OpenAI vs. Google could be the heavyweight battle of the half-century
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: OpenAI is preparing to launch an AI-powered web browser in the coming weeks. More than 400 million people already use OpenAI's ChatGPT as their interface to the web. An OpenAI browser could pose a serious challenge to Google's $200 billion interactive advertising machine. The Department of Justice is demanding that Google divest Chrome.

articles.title: Tech companies team up to train teachers on Ai
articles.summary: $23 million initiative is backed by Microsoft, Open Ai, Anthropic and two teachers' unions. The goal is to train 400-thousand kindergarten through 12th grade teachers in artificial intelligence over the next five years. The National Academy of AI Instruction announced the effort on Tuesday, July 8.

articles.title: Musk Launches Grok 4 Amid Antisemitism Controversy—Claims It's ‘Smarter Than Almost All Graduate Students'
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI launched Grok 4 on Wednesday night, the latest version of its flagship artificial intelligence model. The company demoed the new model in a live stream featuring Musk. The launch comes a day after the company's chatbot was mired in controversy over a series of antisemitic posts praising Adolf Hitler.

articles.title: Perplexity launches AI-powered Comet browser, and there's a big reason to stay away
articles.summary: Comet is an AI-powered browser with built-in Perplexity AI chatbot. It costs $200/month for Max users, but it will eventually roll out more broadly. It's not about the price, it's about the privacy.

articles.title: OpenAI to launch AI-powered web browser
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: OpenAI is preparing to release an artificial intelligence-powered web browser aimed at challenging Google Chrome's market dominance. The move could impact Google's ad revenue, as Chrome is a key component of Alphabet's advertising business. OpenAI acquired io, an AI devices startup, for $6.5bn in May 2025.

articles.title: Microsoft saves $500 million using AI weeks after laying off 9,000 workers, reports $26 billion Q1 profit
articles.author: Shubhangi Chowdhury
articles.summary: Microsoft made a profit of $26 billion in the first quarter on $70 billion in revenue. The company has laid off nearly 4% of its workforce. Microsoft is investing heavily in AI education. It will give more than $4 billion in cash and technology services for AI training.

articles.title: BTIG Keeps Buy Rating on Wingstop (WING), Highlights Recent Tech Investments
articles.author: Ali Ahmed
articles.summary: BTIG maintained its 'Buy' rating for Wingstop Inc. (NASDAQ:WING) with a price target of $430. BTIG highlighted the company's focus on improving its digital and advertising efforts and international expansion as key factors driving growth for the company.

articles.title: AI-Powered Hope: Transforming Refugee Lives Through Innovation
articles.author: Soumoshree Mukherjee
articles.summary: UNHCR's Innovation Service is reimagining how AI can transform refugee services. By 2030, UNHCR aims to connect 20 million refugees to digital resources. Mobile payments are proving vital for financial inclusion. Reskilling is now a key focus for young people in refugee camps.

articles.title: Tool devised for detecting AI that scores high on accuracy, low on false accusations
articles.author: Jeff Karoub
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Michigan developed a tool that can tell if a piece of writing written by AI passes both the "zero-shot statistical tests" and the "liketropy" test. They hope the tool will be useful in academia and public policy as AI content proliferates.

articles.title: IQVIA Unveils New Custom AI Agents with NVIDIA
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: IQVIA Holdings Inc. (NYSE:IQV) unveiled new custom-built AI agents at GTC Paris on June 11. The AI agents were developed in collaboration with NVIDIA Corp. (NASDAQ:NVDA). IQVIA provides clinical research services, commercial insights, and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences & healthcare industries in the Americas, Europe, Africa, and the Asia-Pacific. IQV is one of the most undervalued NYSE stocks to buy now.

articles.title: OpenAI's next big launch could be an AI web browser
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: According to Reuters, OpenAI is planning to launch an AI web browser in the 'coming weeks' The browser will feature a ChatGPT interface and will be powered by Google's open-source engine, Chromium. Perplexity launched a Chromium-based web browser called Comet this week.

articles.title: Taking Issue with ‘Tech Overlords'
articles.author: Jim Turner
articles.summary: DeSantis on June 30 vetoed a bill dealing with automation and artificial intelligence. The bill passed the Legislature in April with only one dissenting vote. It would have directed part of the state Department of Commerce to study issues such as job losses and gains. DeSantis criticized a congressional proposal that would have prevented states from regulating AI.

articles.title: Musk says Grok chatbot is coming to Tesla vehicles by next week

articles.summary: Elon Musk announced on Thursday that his chatbot Grok will be coming to Tesla vehicles next week at the latest. The announcement comes a day after the chatbot posted antisemitic content on his social media platform X. The integration suggests an expanded relationship between the electric-car maker and xAI.

articles.title: H.C. Wainwright Remains Bullish on Harmony Biosciences Holdings (HRMY)
articles.author: Noor Ul Ain Rehman
articles.summary: Harmony Biosciences Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:HRMY) is one of the 13 Cheap Healthcare Stocks with Huge Upside Potential. The company reported strong fiscal Q1 2025 results, with net revenue for WAKIX (pitolisant) in narcolepsy reaching $184.7 million for the quarter. It projects 2025 net revenue to be in the range of $820 to $860 million. It also experienced a 19% year-over-year increase in net income, building on four consecutive years of profitability.

articles.title: Cantor Fitzgerald Lowers PT on Centene Corporation (CNC) to $65 From $90, Keeps an Overweight Rating

articles.title: BofA Raises Price Target on Charter Communications (CHTR) to $500 from $450, Maintains a Buy Rating
articles.author: Noor Ul Ain Rehman
articles.summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ:CHTR) is one of the AI stocks that offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk. The company's offerings include Spectrum TV, Spectrum Internet, and Spectrum Voice, and it also offers data networking, business-to-business Internet access, video and music entertainment services, business telephone, and wireless backhaul.

articles.title: Meta Is Reportedly Paying an Apple Engineer Over $200 Million to Join Its Superintelligence Effort
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: Ruoming Pang has been hired by Meta as an AI expert. Pang worked at Google for 15 years before joining Apple in 2021. He will work on Meta's superintelligence team developing AI that surpasses human capabilities. Mark Zuckerberg wants to make Meta the first company to achieve superintelligence and embed AI in its products.

articles.title: Employee AI Agents: A Strategic Guide to Adoption and Success
articles.summary: Employee AI agents are sophisticated AI systems designed to automate tasks, provide support, and augment human capabilities. They leverage technologies like natural language processing (NLP), machine learning (ML), and robotic process automation (RPA). Common applications include IT support, HR assistance, onboarding support, policy clarification, data entry and processing, and knowledge management.

articles.title: £2 Million Raised for Voice AI: How Andy Studio Plans to Slash Operational Costs by 70%

Voice AI is revolutionising how businesses handle customer interactions. Domino's Pizza uses Voice AI to handle 80% of its phone orders in North America. Andy Studio is a product studio that builds AI-powered solutions across various industries. Its project for a European service company raised $2 million to reinvent its operations using Voice AI.

articles.title: Artificial Agency Launches Behavior Engine to Create Video Games That Feel Truly Alive
articles.author: Nasdaq Globe Newswire
articles.summary: Technology empowers developers to add agentic intelligence to any system within a game, creating characters, events, and AI within the game.      Â  “Agony Intelligence” is a technology that allows developers to create characters and events.

articles.title: Google finally solved one of the Gemini assistant's most frustrating problems
articles.author: Karandeep Singh Oberoi
articles.summary: Gemini, Google's AI assistant, comes pre-installed on all the latest Samsung Galaxy devices, including the lates Galaxy Z Flip 7 and Z Fold 7. At Unpacked yesterday, Google announced several new bells and whistles that are first making their way to Gemini on the new Galaxy devices and then to all phones. The Gemini Live app can now run on the cover screen of the new Z foldable. Users can access information from Samsung apps without having to start a conversation first.

articles.title: Flipping Robot Senses and Movement On Its Head
articles.author: Berivan Kilic
articles.summary: The AgiBot X2-N is an eyeless or camera-less robot. It is perfectly balanced and can move up and down steps and slopes without any visual input. How will this change the world of robotics?   Â

articles.title: Google AI's new trick: Turn any image into a brief video
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: Google's new AI video tool, Veo 3, generates short movies with sound based only on still photos and prompts. The feature is available to Ultra and Pro users on the web and soon on mobile for subscribers in select regions. Axios test-drove the feature and found it diverting.

articles.title: Generative AI is Turning Publishing Into a Swamp of Slop
articles.author: Horacio Villalobos
articles.summary: Generative AI is turning publishing into a swamp of slop. Authors have been caught using AI to steal their work. Traditional publishers have invested heavily in AI. Authors and translators have lost work and income due to generative AI. Spines plans to publish up to 8,000 books by offering writers the chance to have their books edited, formatted and designed with AI.

articles.title: Google's Gemini AI App Can Now Turn Photos Into Short Video Clips
articles.author: Natalie Lung
articles.summary: Google is adding the ability for paid users of its Gemini artificial intelligence assistant to turn their photos into short video clips. People who subscribe to Google AI Ultra and Pro plans in select regions will be able to use the feature through the web version of Gemini starting Thursday. The update makes the powerful feature accessible via Gemini's chat interface.

articles.title: AI makes it increasingly difficult to know what's real
articles.author: Sarah Lerch
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a computer system that can perform complex tasks normally done by human-reasoning, decision-making and creating. John McCarthy used the term 'artificial intelligence' in a workshop in the mid-50s. It's difficult to tell if an AI-generated image or video is real or not.

articles.title: Meta Platforms Enticed Apple AI Executive With $200M Pay Package, Report Says
articles.author: Nisha Gopalan
articles.summary: Meta Platforms offered Ruoming Pang, Apple's top executive in charge of artificial intelligence models, a pay package worth more than $200 million. Apple didn't try to match the offer. Meta shares are up by almost a quarter this year while those of Apple are down more than 15%.

articles.title: Musk unveils ‘PhD-level' Grok 4 AI following Nazi chatbot uproar
articles.summary: Elon Musk has unveiled the new version of the Grok chatbot. The previous version of Grok got into trouble after it made some offensive statements. The new version offers PhD-level intelligence. It also has a new code mode and a new Multimodal Input format for text and video.

articles.title: HSBC upgrades AMD as AI chip pricing could drive major upside through 2026
articles.author: Pratyush Thakur
articles.summary: HSBC upgraded Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) to Buy and doubled its price target to $200. HSBC raised its 2026 AI revenue forecast to $15.1 billion, 57% above consensus. The firm lifted its 2025 and 2026 earnings estimates by 13% and 23%.

articles.title: European firms must accelerate AI adoption, Accenture EMEA CEO says
articles.summary: Mauro Macchi, Accenture's EMEA CEO, discusses their latest research on artificial intelligence adoption in Europe with John MacGregor of Accenture Research.    "The future of artificial intelligence in Europe lies in the development of AI."

articles.title: Rubio Warns of AI Impersonation Risks: 'A Great Challenge'
articles.summary: Secretary Rubio is concerned about AI impersonator. He thinks it's one of the challenges posed to us by AI.    Your browser does not support the video tag.  iReport.com will send you a link to the video to the article.

articles.title: 5 Leadership Traits That Matter More Than Ever In An AI-Driven Economy
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the workplace. Emotional intelligence, adaptability, creativity, self-management, resilience, flexibility, social influence, curiosity, and a commitment to lifelong learning are some of the key leadership traits that matter more than ever in an AI-driven economy.

articles.title: Wall Street Sees 46% Upside for This Chipmaker
articles.author: Avi Eberstein
articles.summary: HSBC and Melius Research upgraded AMD to 'Buy' with price targets of $200 and $211, respectively. AMD's stock price rose over 4% to $144.16 in early trading on Thursday. The company's focus on high-performance chips for AI applications positions it to capture substantial market share in the rapidly expanding AI-driven semiconductor industry.

articles.title: Huawei Seeks AI Chip Customers in Middle East, Southeast Asia
articles.author: Mackenzie Hawkins
articles.summary: Huawei Technologies is trying to export small quantities of AI chips to the Middle East and Southeast Asia in an effort to establish a foothold in markets dominated by Nvidia Corp. The company is also trying to woo customers with remote access to CloudMatrix 384, a China-based AI system built with more advanced Ascend 910C chips. Saudi Arabia seems open to potential purchases.

articles.title: Geoffrey Hinton Warns Current A.I. May Soon Grow Past Its ‘Cute Tiger Cub' Phase
articles.author: New York Observer
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is an acclaimed computer scientist often dubbed the 'Godfather of A.I.' for his work on AI. Hinton has become a cautionary voice for the technology's development. He believes we are in the situation of someone who has a tiger cub.

articles.title: ‘Coding is dead': UW computer science program rethinks curriculum for the AI era
articles.author: Lisa Stiffler
articles.summary: The rapid adoption of artificial intelligence in the workplace has academic institutions wrestling with the question of how best to prepare the next generation of graduates for tech jobs. The strategy at the University of Washington's Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering is to graduate nimble problem-solvers who understand computing fundamentals. Harshitha Rebala received her computer science bachelor's degree from the Allen School in June. She was hired as a technical staff member at Vercept, a startup founded by former Allen Institute for AI founder.

articles.title: Grok is coming to Tesla vehicles ‘next week,' says Elon Musk
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.summary: Elon Musk announced on X that Grok, the chatbot from his AI company, xAI, will be coming to Tesla vehicles 'very soon' or next week at the latest. The announcement comes several hours after xAI debuted the latest flagship AI model Grok 4. The update also comes as adjustments to Grok have made it more prone to misbehavior, including making anti-semitic comments and slating Democrats. X temporarily took down Grok temporarily on Wednesday to solve the problem.

articles.title: Elon Musk says AI chatbot Grok will be added to Tesla cars by next week
articles.author: Taylor Herzlich
articles.summary: Elon Musk announced Thursday that his AI chatbot Grok will be available in Tesla vehicles by next week. The chatbot is currently available on X, the social media platform formerly known as Twitter that Musk acquired in 2022. On Tuesday, the chatbot praised Adolf Hitler and spread antisemitic hate on X.

articles.title: An AI researcher says most jobs will be wiped out by 2045 — but sex ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: As AI and robotics advance, experts say societies must rethink how work, value and purpose are defined in a world with fewer human jobs. A think tank boss believes AI will replace humans as the main source of value in the future and replace human workers with machines.

articles.title: People Are Using AI to Flirt on Dating Apps—Then Disappointing Their Dates
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: Richard Wilson, 31, went on a second date with someone who couldn't maintain a simple one-on-one in-person conversation to save his life. Dating apps like Hinge and Tinder say AI can help people who are 'too busy, shy, or abrasive to win dates'

articles.title: Musk releases latest Grok version after antisemitism controversy
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI company xAI unveiled the newest version of its chatbot Grok on Wednesday. It comes amid fallout from a recent update that resulted in numerous antisemitic responses from the chatbot. The official Grok account said Tuesday that xAI was working to remove 'inappropriate posts' and had taken action to ban hate speech.

articles.title: Rough Draft: When keyboards go silent
articles.author: SAMIE HARTLEY
articles.summary: This week there was no Have Your Say feature on the Opinion page. Samie Hartley is looking for readers' feedback on the feature. She wants to make it a place for readers to share thoughts, ideas and answers to silly or serious questions. She's been at this new weekly print format for nearly 6 months.

articles.title: AI slows down some experienced software developers, study finds
articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.summary: A new study by AI research nonprofit METR found that using cutting-edge artificial intelligence tools slowed experienced software developers when working in codebases familiar to them. The study's lead authors, Joel Becker and Nate Rush, said they were shocked by the results as they had expected a 2x speed up.

articles.title: Inside the AI startup frenzy: ‘Everyone's pivoting, then pivoting again'
articles.author: Alex Heath
articles.summary: Ellis Hamburger is the founder of Meaning, a marketing firm that works with a lot of AI startups. He used to work at The Verge shortly after it launched in 2012 and covered the early mobile app boom. He also worked at The Browser Company and Snap. He recorded this episode in Los Angeles with Alex Heath.

articles.title: Idaho preps to roll out artificial intelligence in state government
articles.summary: The new chatbot combs through the Idaho Division of Human Resources's website to give visitors quick answers. It's powered by artificial intelligence, or AI, and it's available on the state government website. It works by combing through the state's website.

articles.title: AI-Driven Incident Management Needs Human Empathy
articles.author: Gary Drenik
articles.summary: In Prosper Insights & Analytics survey, 27% of respondents indicated they were already using AI. 78% of organizations surveyed expect to increase AI spending in the next fiscal year. AI-driven tools are revolutionizing the process of incident detection with their ability to rapidly discover system anomalies and other technical issues faster than humans can. However, AI can't put incidents in a business context. Only humans can put the incident in perspective and orchestrate and align it with business strategy and continuity.

articles.title: WSLS Night at Salem Fair Drives Charitable Donations
articles.summary: WSLS is using artificial intelligence to improve news gathering and reporting. This year's WSLS Night at the Salem Fair raised over $15,000 for local charities. The money went to the Rescue Mission of Roanoke, Feeding Southwest Virginia, and Bradley Free Clinic.

articles.title: HighField AI Now Commercially Available, Advancing Broadcast Graphics with Intelligent Automation
articles.author: Mark K. Miller
articles.summary: Highfield AI is a broadcast industry agentic and multimodal AI platform for automating graphics production. The platform uses AI agents to analyze stories created within NRCS systems and automatically manage graphics assembly. Broadcasters participating in initial trials have reported efficiency gains of up to 75% in graphics production workflows.

articles.title: ChatGPT hardware confirmed, as OpenAI closes $6.5B deal for Jony Ive's startup
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: OpenAI has bought Jony Ive's startup, io Products, for $6.5 billion. io will make ChatGPT hardware for the AI firm. Sam Altman tested a prototype of the iyO wearable computer that is partly funded by Google.

articles.title: 'It Won't Be The Last Time:' AI Impersonation of Rubio Raise Concern On National Security
articles.summary: Someone is impersonating Secretary of State Marco Rubio by using artificial intelligence to contact foreign leaders and U.S. lawmakers. The messages were sent via text, Signal and voicemail. The State Department warned that an imposter posing as Rubio had reached out to at least three unidentified foreign ministers, a senator and a governor.
